command: dd if=/dev/sda of=/var/tmp/system_current.img bs=4M status=progress && sha256sum /var/tmp/system_current.img | awk '{print $1 "  /var/tmp/system_current.img"}' > /var/tmp/system_current.sha256 && diff -u baseline/system.sha256 /var/tmp/system_current.sha256
explanation: Creates a full disk image snapshot and compares its SHA-256 signature line against a stored baseline signature to detect any unauthorized system image changes.
rationale_steps: Use dd to image the entire disk to a temporary file.
Compute and format the SHA-256 signature line for the captured image.
Diff the signature line against a baseline signature file to confirm integrity.
